Heading: Did Washington Post repeat Pakistani conspiracy theory about ‚ÄòDisinfo Lab‚Äô? Copy-paste journalism, reliance on lunatic who wanted Mamata Banerjee raped, claims about ‚ÄòSkinDoctor‚Äô
Article: Despite his questionable character and dwindling credibility, Aveek Sen's misleading tweets on 'Disinfo Lab' became the primary fodder for both 'Pakistani Defence' and 'The Washington Post'.A day after The Washington Post carried out a hit job on Indian OSINT (Open Source Intelligence)¬†handle¬†‚ÄòDisinfo Lab‚Äô, it has come to light that some of the outlandish claims made by the American newspaper bear an uncanny resemblance to conspiracy theories peddled by a Pakistani website.In an attempt to de-legitimise ‚ÄòDisinfo Lab‚Äô, The Washington Post claimed on Sunday (10th December) that the OSINT handle is run by an Indian Research and Analysis Wing (R&AW) officer named Lt. Col. Dibya Satpathy.Although it relied on word salad, insinuations, ‚Äòsource-based‚Äô allegations and dubious ‚Äòexperts‚Äô, the American newspaper failed to provide any empirical evidence that could dispute any claims of ‚ÄòDisinfo Lab.‚ÄôInterestingly, a large part of the purported ‚Äòinvestigation‚Äô by The Washington Post on the Indian OSINT handle appears to be based on conspiracy theories peddled by a website named ‚ÄòPakistan Defence.‚ÄôIn an article titled ‚ÄòDisinfo Lab ‚Äì A Disinformation Project of Indian RA&W‚Äô, published by the website in February 2022, a staff writer Amaa‚Äôn relied on outlandish claims made by ‚Äòjournalist‚Äô Aveek Sen to draw links between ‚ÄòDisinfo Lab‚Äô and Indian Intelligence.The ‚ÄòPakistan Defence‚Äô article made references to Lt. Colonel Dibya Satpathy, Ajayendra Tripathi, and BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga ‚Äì all of whom appear prominently in the propaganda piece of The Washington Post.The Pakistani website presented the accusations of Aveek Sen, an abusive troll, as the ‚Äògospel truth.‚Äô In the tweet from 2013 that went viral, Aveek Sen was seen quoting TimesNow, saying that Mamata Banerjee had called the Barasat rapists ‚ÄòCPIM supporters‚Äô. To that, Aveek Sen had responded saying ‚ÄúIts high time these cpm supporters rape Mamata!‚ÄùPrior to deleting his account, Aveek Sen had made several dergatory comments targeting women. A few of his archived misogynist tweets can be seen here ‚Äì In several of his tweets, Aveek Sen was seen referring to women as ‚Äòprostitutes.‚ÄôDespite his questionable character and dwindling credibility, Sen‚Äôs misleading tweets on ‚ÄòDisinfo Lab‚Äô became the primary fodder for both ‚ÄòPakistani Defence‚Äô and ‚ÄòThe Washington Post‚Äô. Interestingly, he had also collaborated with the likes of propaganda outlets such as Newslaundry.‚ÄúAnd the making of Indian fake disinfo lab, copying the famous eu disinfo lab that exposed hundreds and thousands of fake Indian websites (By author Aveek sen),‚Äù read a line from the article on ‚ÄòPakistan Defence.‚ÄôCoincidentally, a similar language is used in the report published by The Washington Post. ‚ÄúAnother person, a former employee, said the Disinfo Lab named and modelled itself after groups such as the Atlantic Council‚Äôs Digital Forensic Research Lab and the EU DisinfoLab, a Brussels-based nonprofit that researches disinformation targeting Europe,‚Äù it claimed.It claimed, ‚ÄúSome of the fronts, setup by Colonel Dibya Satpathy, per Aveek Sen‚Äôs revelation, include: Root N Wings Media, situated at B-3, Bali‚Äôs, Near BSES Office, Arya Samaj Mandir, Lajpat Nagar 2, Delhi. Flat A-20, Lajpat Nagar 3, near Ring Road, Delhi.‚ÄùInterestingly, the claims made it to the report of The Washington Post as well. ‚ÄúThe Disinfo Lab, which at one point consisted of about a dozen private contractors working out of a four-story whitewashed building on a leafy street in New Delhi,‚Äù the leftist newspaper wrote.In another paragraph, it said, ‚ÄúThe office operated under the name Root and Wings Media.‚Äù Based on Aveek Sen‚Äôs tweets, the shady Pakistani website alleged that Lt. Colonel Dibya Satpathy had been campaigning against the country on the behest of R&AW and BJP.OpIndia found yet another uncanny resemblance in the report of The Washington Post where it said, ‚ÄúThe Disinfo Lab itself was headed by Satpathy, whose work has focused mostly on countering Pakistan.‚Äù‚ÄúThe Disinfo Lab‚Äôs activities show how the online propaganda campaigns waged by the BJP and its allies have been expanding beyond their traditional, domestic aims of shoring up popular support and denigrating opposition parties ‚Äî and now seek to influence attitudes far beyond India‚Äôs borders,‚Äù the American newspaper claimed in another part of the article.Both The Washington Post and ‚ÄòPakistan Defence‚Äô made specific references to ‚ÄòRoot Wings Media‚Äô and characterised it as a ‚Äòsocial media marketing company/ campaign agency.‚Äô‚ÄúThe company has no more than ten employees, typical of an intelligence front,‚Äù the Pakistani website said. And this is what the American newspaper claimed ‚Äì ‚ÄúThe Disinfo Lab, which at one point consisted of about a dozen private contractors.‚Äù¬†Both The Washingon Post and ‚ÄòPakistan Defence‚Äô targeted targeted the ‚ÄòDisinfo Lab‚Äô for exposing the United States Commission on International Religious Freedom (USCIRF) and its¬†biased reporting¬†on India, which is often used to cast aspersions on Indian democracy.‚ÄúSome of the investigative reports published by this website include one aiming to discredit the United States Commission on International Religious Freedom,‚Äù wrote ‚ÄòPakistan Defence.‚Äô‚ÄúThe Disinfo Lab often cites publicly available U.S. lobbying and campaign finance records and produces complex flowcharts to illustrate alleged relationships. But the group draws tenuous connections, claiming, for instance, that a USCIRF commissioner was influenced by Islamists because she once worked on a conservative fundraising committee alongside a lobbyist who went on to represent Muslim American groups,‚Äù claimed The Washington Post.In February this year, OpIndia¬†reported¬†in detail about the ties of former USCIRF Commissioner Anurima Bhargava to far-left billionaire George Soros. We also exposed how the controversial body has relied on the¬†dubious ‚ÄòTek Fog‚Äô story¬†to make insinuations about India.The Washington Post ensured to not include all conspiracy theories to set its ‚Äòinvestigative article‚Äô apart from that of ‚ÄòPakistan Defence.‚Äô The Pakistani website had even dubbed popular member and¬†dermatologist¬†Neelam Singh aka ‚ÄòThe Skin Doctor‚Äô as an aide to R&AW officer Lt. Colonel Dibya Satpathy.‚ÄúThe Evil nexus of Col Dibya Satpathy Indian ex-military intelligence officer and bjp troll farms. To (sic) manufacture and spread propaganda and misinformation with the help of Major Neelam ‚ÄúNeel‚Äù Kumari alias ‚ÄúThe Skin Doctor‚Äù, Major Gaurav Arya,‚Äù it claimed.‚ÄòPakistan Defence‚Äô accused ‚ÄòThe Skin Doctor‚Äô of carrying out the ‚Äòevil nexus‚Äô of supposed ‚ÄòDisinfo Lab‚Äô founder and Indian Intelligence officerThe Washington Post did not copy-paste the outrageous claims about ‚ÄòDisinfo Lab‚Äô only from ‚ÄòPakistan Defence‚Äô but another Pakistani-based website named ‚ÄòCentre for Strategic and Contemporary Research (CSCR).Interestingly, CSCR published another misleading piece on ‚ÄòDisinfo Lab‚Äô a year before that of ‚ÄòPakistan Defence.‚Äô Habitual fake news peddler and anti-Hindu activist CJ Werleman had made similar insinuations about the Indian OSINT handle in February last year.First, the claim of our association with Govt agencies/ RAW. The report is essentially a recycle of previous reports published by Pakistani ISPR/ Info-war machinery. The report is periodically recycled, last by known fake news peddler CJ Werleman.Lazy Journalism!(2/n) pic.twitter.com/0oXNGfrVyoIn November 2021, CJ Werleman had¬†appealed¬†to boycott Indian products to supposedly ‚Äòsave‚Äô Muslims in India and Kashmir. Before that, he had¬†tweeted a video of Pramod Muthalik,¬†the chief of the Hindu activist group Shri Rama Sene, to allege that he called for violence against Muslims and the demolition of a mosque in Karnataka. Earlier, he claimed Indians had¬†destroyed¬†a Muslim graveyard in Himachal Pradesh, which was also fake news. In August 2021 when the Islamist group Taliban took over Afghanistan, Werleman was caught spreading Taliban propaganda. In September 2021, he called for¬†‚Äòregime decapitation‚Äô¬†strikes against India.The Print, run by Shekhar Gupta had eulogised Werleman in a¬†profile¬†describing him as a ‚Äòbigot-turned-crusader against ‚ÄòIslamophobia‚Äô who is taking on the Indian state‚Äô. Since every anti-India propagandist is a potential source of The Washington Post, there will surely be no dearth of more anti-India hit pieces ahead of the 2024 elections.While hitting out at The Washington Post, ‚ÄòDisinfo Lab‚Äô pointed out that the only difference in its article and past hitjobs against it is the addition of unnamed sources. ‚ÄúThe only ‚Äòupgrade‚Äô the WaPo did was to make this Pakistani allegation ‚Äòanonymous‚Äô. And whatever is in addition to that is again attributed to ‚Äòanonymous‚Äô sources. Hence, literally, every fact claimed is ‚Äòanonymous‚Äô. The report has more than 10 anonymous sources,‚Äù it added.As pointed out earlier by OpIndia, The Washington Post failed to refute any assertions made by ‚ÄòDisinfo Lab.‚Äô It also noted, ‚ÄúWhile, in their questions to us and other people, WaPo journalists have themselves noted that our claims are factually correct! (thanks for acknowledgement), they alleged that we make ‚Äòtenuous claims‚Äô, and cited a few examples.‚ÄùWhile calling out the bluff of the leftist newspaper, Disinfo Lab concluded that The Washington Post is overrated. ‚ÄúIt is not surprising that people who don‚Äôt understand OSINT are baffled by our reporting. It is especially hard for legacy media journos ‚Äì Indian and foreign alike, who have known journalism only as handouts from sources. Agencies are overrated. Heading: Pakistan: 3 policemen killed, 16 injured as terrorists blow up a police station in Dera Ismail Khan
Article: According to the police, the rebels rammed a car full of explosives at the main gate of DI Khan's Daraban police station. As a result, three cops named Havaldar, Riyasat and Sepoy Zulfiqar were killed.Three policemen have been killed and 16 injured as terrorists rammed an explosive-laden car into a police station in Dera Ismail Khan, ARY News reported on Tuesday.ARY News is a Pakistani news channel.According to the police, the rebels rammed a car full of explosives at the main gate of DI Khan‚Äôs Daraban police station. As a result, three cops named Havaldar, Riyasat and Sepoy Zulfiqar were killed.Meanwhile, the police also shot two terrorists during an exchange of fire as they tried to enter the premises.The police station‚Äôs roof collapsed as a result of the attack.The injured were shifted to DI Khan Hospital, the police said, adding that Daraban Tehsil has been completely cordoned off. Heavy contingents of police have reached the spot, as per ARY News.Scheduled papers at schools and colleges in Tehsil Draban have been cancelled following the terror attack.As per ARY News, this is not the first time that a police station in Dera Ismail Khan has been attacked. Earlier in October, a police station in KP‚Äôs Dera Ismail Khan district came under attack in which terrorists also used hand grenades and rockets.An attack was carried out on Dera Ismail Khan‚Äôs Hathala police station from two sides, leaving two cops wounded. However, the police repulsed the attack and forced the attackers to flee.¬†(This news report is published from a syndicated feed. Heading: Opposition forced to use ‚Äòdirty money‚Äô due to electoral bonds: Raghu Ram Rajan steps out to defend Congress MP linked to 500 cr Income...
Article: Dr Rajan, who joined Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's Bharat Jodo Yatra last year on the economy, came out in defence of UPA-2 and claimed that the country did not progress much during 2009-2014 because UPA-2 was not in the majority. In an interview published by The Red Mike on 12th December, former Governor of Reserve Bank of India, Dr Raghuram Rajan, gave a bizarre ‚Äúcontext‚Äù to the unaccounted cash recovered from Congress Rajya Sabha MP Dhiraj Prasad Sahu. Dr Rajan claimed that the opposition parties are ‚Äúforced‚Äù to use illicit money because electoral bonds provide an unequal playing field favouring the ruling party.In his question, Sanket Upadhyay asked Dr Rajan about his views on electoral bonds, citing the statement given by former finance secretary Subhash Chandra Garg at Idea Exchange. Garg thoroughly explained why electoral bonds were introduced and what the ill effects of removing them from the system would be. Sanket asked Dr Rajan about his views on the statement where Garg said that if electoral bonds are removed, it will be cash on the streets yearly in the political process.Dr Rajan asserted electoral bonds are an utterly non-transparent way of financing. Parties receive funds, and what they get is not known to anyone. In case an industrialist gives 1,000 crores to a party, the public can never know. He further called it a ‚Äúbad way of financing elections‚Äù as the only people who know who donated what are the State Bank of India. He claimed that in India, it is hard to maintain secrets, and the ruling party can find the information of the business houses that donated to the opposition parties.Dr Rajan speaks on the Dheeraj Sahu cash recovery in the context of Electoral Bonds. Do listen to his views below. Full intw ‚Äì https://t.co/HTcXOGc7cW pic.twitter.com/cD9yHKKTUoDr Rajan said, ‚ÄúI do not say it happens, but the ruling party can call up the people who gave money to the opposition parties and ask them why they donated to so and so party.‚Äù He further claimed that this is why opposition parties must use cash instead of electoral bonds. ‚ÄúElections are fought on money,‚Äù he added.Furthermore, he said that for the elections, the ruling party could use agencies like the Enforcement Directorate, the Income Tax Department, and the Central Bureau of Investigation to conduct raids against the leaders of the opposition parties. For example, in the recent attacks against Dhiraj Prasad Sahu, Dr Rajan asserted that the money could have been used to fight elections.What is notable here is that even the Congress party could not develop this bizarre theory. Congress leader Jairam Ramesh categorically stated the party had nothing to do with the money recovered from premises linked to Sahu. While the Congress party distanced itself from the controversy, Dr Rajan felt it necessary to explain why so much cash was stored at premises linked to Sahu.Dr Rajan, who joined Congress leader Rahul Gandhi‚Äôs Bharat Jodo Yatra last year on the economy, came out in defence of UPA-2 and claimed that the country did not progress much during 2009-2014 because UPA-2 was not in the majority. He said that Goods and Service Tax (GST) was introduced during UPA-2 but could not be implemented as opposition parties opposed it. UPA-2 was not in the majority, so it could not be made a law. Notably, the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) was in opposition then. Can you believe?Raghuram Rajan now says policy paralysis of UPA 2 was fault of opposition!He is crying that UPA did not have big enough majorityLOL‚Ä¶ Nehru dynasty had big majorities for 40 years‚Ä¶ they took India's economy DOWN from 6th to 12th largest! pic.twitter.com/XlLfXhz9xJIn a way, he blamed the BJP for the ‚Äúpolicy paralysis‚Äù during UPA-2. Rajan said, ‚ÄúParliament was not allowed to function. You can‚Äôt solely point a finger and say nothing happened. There was partial paralysis; that was was opposition-led also.‚ÄùDhiraj Prasad Sahu is a Rajya Sabha MP for Congress from Jharkhand. His family has been associated with the Congress party since independence. He became Rajya Sabha MP in by-polls in 2009 for the first time. In 2010, he was re-elected as RS MP for the second time; in 2018, he was re-elected for RS by Congress for the third time.Dhiraj Sahu actively participates in parliamentary proceedings. Sahu was also part of Rahul Gandhi‚Äôs Bharat Jodo Yatra. In recent raids at Odisha-based Boudh Distillery Pvt Ltd, where¬†Dhiraj Prasad Sahu¬†is a partner, the Income Tax Department recovered over 400 cr of unaccounted cash. Congress Party has¬†distanced¬†itself from their own MP after the recovery of the cash.Whether NDTV or 'The Wire', they never have to worry about funds. Heading: Rs 20,000 fine for dharnas, Rs 10,000 for anti-national slogans: JNU issues new rules for code of conduct on campus
Article: The JNU Students' Discipline and Conduct Rule has been issued following the approval by the highest decision-making body of the university on November 24.Students at the Jawaharlal Nehru University can face a fine of Rs 20,000 for resorting to violence, holding dharnas, and hunger strikes on the campus and a fine of up to Rs 10,000 for raising anti-national slogans and inciting intolerance towards religion, caste or community.The JNU Students‚Äô Discipline and Conduct Rule has been issued following the approval by the highest decision-making body of the university on November 24.A Chief Proctor Office manual listed the ‚Äúrules of discipline and proper conduct of students of Jawaharlal Nehru University‚Äù.The document accessed by ANI said, ‚ÄúIt was strongly felt to review the existing disciplinary rules and regulations of the office of the Chief Proctor. There are no substantially approved rules and regulations on proper conduct and discipline of students by the statutory body (i.e Executive Council) of JNU in vogue.‚ÄùThe pamphlet mentioned that a student (repeat offender) would be expelled if he or she was awarded 5 (five) or more punishments during the entire duration of the study.Punishments have been listed for 28 types of ‚Äúmisconduct‚Äù, including blockage, indulging in gambling, unauthorised occupation of hostel rooms, use of abusive and derogatory language and committing forgery.For hunger strikes, dharnas, group bargaining and any other form of protest by blocking the entrance or exit of any of the academic and/or administrative complexes or disrupting the movements of any member of the University community, a fine of up to Rs 20,000 will be levied.Students can be fined up to Rs 6,000 for holding events without prior permission, and/or they may have to carry out JNU Community Service.For printing, circulating or pasting posters/pamphlets (text or picture) carrying derogatory religious, communal, casteist or anti-national remarks and any activity that incites intolerance towards religion, caste or community and/or anti-national in nature which disturbs the peaceful atmosphere on the campus, a student can be fined upto Rs 10,000.The JNU Students Union has condemned the new manual saying it is aimed at stifling the vibrant campus culture that has defined the university for decades.‚ÄúSuch excessive regulations are intended to discourage open discussions, dissent, and intellectual exploration, which are fundamental to the spirit of our university. According to the new manual, protests before any academic building can lead to rustication, eviction from the hostel and a fine of Rs 20,000. Moreover, a student who commits any act that the JNU Admin considers to be of moral turpitude can be fined up to Rs 10,000,‚Äù the statement read.
